trans-unit.source: Represents a compiler error or warning.
<xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError> represents a compiler error or a warning that has been returned by the compiler.
This class contains an inheritance demand at the class level that applies to all members.
A <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> is thrown when the derived class does not have full-trust permission.
For details about inheritance demands, see [Inheritance Demands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28b9adbb-8f08-4f10-b856-dbf59eb932d9).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError"></xref> class using the specified file name, line, column, error number, and error text.
The file name of the file that the compiler was compiling when it encountered the error.
The line of the source of the error.
The column of the source of the error.
The error number of the error.
The error message text.
Gets or sets the column number where the source of the error occurs.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError.Column%2A> property can be set to zero for compilers that do not return column information.
The column number of the source file where the compiler encountered the error.
Gets or sets the error number.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError.ErrorNumber%2A> property can contain a string of any length.
The error number as a string.
Gets or sets the text of the error message.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError.ErrorText%2A> property can be a string of any length.
The text of the error message.
Gets or sets the file name of the source file that contains the code which caused the error.
The file name of the source file that contains the code which caused the error.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the error is a warning.
`true` if the error is a warning; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the line number where the source of the error occurs.
The line number of the source file where the compiler encountered the error.
Provides an implementation of Object's <xref href="System.Object.ToString"></xref> method.
This method is supported so <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError> objects can be treated as objects for simplified debugging output.
A string representation of the compiler error.
